title: R-package User Guide
text: MetAlyzer’s primary entry point MetAlyzer::read_webidq() function, reads WebIDQ™ .xlsx output files (Fig. 1). output files contain layered information, inform concentration values color-coded quantification status (e.g., “Valid”, “LOD”, “LOQ”), tedious task reliably process data computationally, mix numerical values status codes hinders direct machine readability standard analysis tools. conveniently read data provide function MetAlyzer::read_webidq(), structuring data SummarizedExperiment (SE) object (Morgan et al. 2025) easy downstream analysis. demonstration ’ll use demo dataset kindly provided BIOCRATES Life Sciences AG, featuring metabolite measurements across two groups (MxP®Quant 500 kit). dataset included MetAlyzer R package example data. Figure 1: Output Biocrates WebIDQ™. resulting SummarizedExperiment object organizes data: Assay: Contains matrices MetAlyzer::conc_values (metabolite concentrations) MetAlyzer::quant_status (quantification status). rowData: Stores metabolite information, including names assigned classes. Note distinction quantified metabolites calculated ‘Metabolism Indicators’. colData: Holds sample-specific metadata provided input file added later. metadata: Contains supplementary information like original file path, sheet index, status color mappings, pre-joined aggregated_data tibble combining concentrations, status, metadata easier analysis plotting. Preview Assay containing concentration values. Preview Assay containing rowData. Preview Assay containing colData.
code: # Access the example data file path fpath <- MetAlyzer::load_demodata_biocrates()  # Load the data into a SummarizedExperiment object metalyzer_se <- MetAlyzer::read_webidq(fpath,                                        silent = TRUE)  # Display the object summary metalyzer_se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 1019 20  #> metadata(4): file_path sheet_index status_list aggregated_data #> assays(2): conc_values quant_status #> rownames(1019): C0 C2 ... TG 22:6_34:3 Choline #> rowData names(1): metabolic_classes #> colnames(20): 14 15 ... 32 33 #> colData names(13): Plate bar code Sample bar code ... Injection number #>   Measurement time

title: R-package User Guide
text: MetAlyzer R package include processing differential analysis , ’s aim import Biocrates files visualize results. Given many tools R packages dedicated quality control differential analysis, decided focus within R package. can either use MetAlyzer shiny app, MetAlyzer helper functions used shiny app dedicated R-packages specifically designed support analysis MetaProViz R package (Schmidt et al. 2025). familiar using R, can use shiny app, whole process start finish (Link MetAlyzer Shiny App). already differential analysis results, can skip section just load internal example data differential analysis results MetAlyzer::toy_diffres(). Preview Assay containing colData. ::: {style=“text-align: justify”} table contains columns metabolite names (Metabolite), class (Class), calculated log2 fold change (log2FC), adjusted p-values (adj.P.Val). can directly use dataframe input MetAlyzer visualization functions. :::
code: diffres_df <- readRDS(MetAlyzer::toy_diffres())  head(diffres_df) %>%   kableExtra::kbl(caption = "Preview of Assay containing colData.") %>%   kableExtra::kable_classic(full_width = F, html_font = "Cambria", font_size = 12) #@Add: t-value column into the example data!

title: R-package User Guide
text: plotting functions MetAlyzer::plot_scatter() MetAlyzer::plot_network() can accept standard data frame containing differential expression results. example data generated raw extraction data, compares concentrations different tissue types. (ADD?) biological informations!

title: R-package User Guide
text: MetAlyzer::plot_scatter() function visualizes log2 fold changes, primarily assess behavior different metabolite classes. Background colors distinguish classes, enabling users interpret certain groups metabolites exhibit distinct regulatory patterns (e.g., consistent /-regulation, specific ranges fold changes). plot horizontally separated extraction method (“LC” left, “FIA” right), allowing comparison whether observed class-specific trends consistent across methods show method-dependent variations.
code: # Scatter plot grouped by metabolic class MetAlyzer::plot_scatter(diffres_df)

title: R-package User Guide
text: Visualize significant changes across metabolic pathways using MetAlyzer::plot_network(). function maps log2 fold changes (log2FC) metabolites onto predefined network structure, representing known biochemical reactions relationships.  T14 Node detailed Information
code: # Generate network plot from the data frame # Requires metabolite, class, log2fc, and p-value columns network <- MetAlyzer::plot_network(   diffres_df,   q_value = 0.05,   metabolite_col = "Metabolite",   values_col_name = "log2FC",   stat_col_name = "qval",   metabolite_text_size = 2,   connection_width = 0.75,   pathway_text_size = 4,   pathway_width = 4, ) #> Warning: Removing 4 invalid nodes.  network$Plot T14_node_expanded <- network$Table%>%   dplyr::filter(Label == "T14")%>%   tidyr::separate_rows(Metabolites, values, stat, sep = "\\s*;\\s*") %>%   dplyr::rename(p.val = stat, Log2FC = values) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     Log2FC = as.numeric(Log2FC),     p.val = as.numeric(p.val)   )

title: R-package User Guide
text: network visualization provides systems-level perspective, going beyond individual metabolite changes. relevance lies helping users understand metabolic perturbations interconnected within broader context biological pathways. examining network, users can: * Identify affected pathways: Observe clusters connected nodes significant changes (indicated color) within labeled pathways (e.g., “TCA Cycle”, “Fatty Acids”, “Bile Acids” seen Figure X). suggests potential - -regulation entire metabolic processes. * Understand relationships: Trace connections metabolites see changes one area might influence others upstream downstream. * Generate hypotheses: Patterns observed network can suggest underlying mechanisms key regulatory points affected experimental conditions. Importantly, colour coding metabolites user can chosse different information like Log2FC, t-value also p-value, dependent needs.

title: R-package User Guide
text: node network represents metabolite metabolite class. color node typically reflects log2FC value (incase viridis scale selected, yellow represents positiv log2 Fold Change purlbe negative log2 Fold Change). nodes, ‘T14’ might group related species like ‘T 14:0_32:2’, ‘T 14:0_34:0’, ‘T 14:0_34:1’, display summarized value. value calculated according following hierarchy prioritize significant findings: 1. Mean Significant: one metabolites mapping node statistically significant (e.g., based FDR corrected p-values), node’s value represents mean log2FC significant metabolites. 2. Mean Measured: none associated metabolites significant, measurements exist , node’s value represents mean log2FC measured metabolites mapping node. 3. NA: metabolites mapping node measured included dataset, node value NA (often represented grey uncolored, like nodes Figure X). summarization approach provides concise overview within network, highlighting significant changes present, still providing context measured data significance reached. Due changing naming convention Biocrates, include old names excel file, show NA later generated WebIDQ™ outputs (e.g. TG(14:0_32.2)), enables analysis older files well. (ADD?) need date , like year exports work, guidance someone can export required old names form WebIDQ know works

title: Differential analysis — calc_log2FC
text: Perform differential analysis add results table input `SummarizedExperiment` (SE) object. analysis conducted using limma package, yielding log2 fold changes, p-values, adjusted p-values. Note input data must already log2 transformed, subset variable interest contains two groups.

title: Differential analysis — calc_log2FC
text: metalyzer_se SE object output read_webidq(). group character specifying sample metadata column containing two groups compared. group_level length-2 vector characters specifying group members `group`, decides direction comparisons. example, c('', 'B') compares Group B, vice versa. Default NULL (alphabetically).

title: Differential analysis — calc_log2FC
text: SE object added table differential analysis results, accessible via `metalyzer_se@metadata$log2FC`.

what: Helper function to calculate conditional mean based on significance — calculate_conditional_mean
title: Helper function to calculate conditional mean based on significance — calculate_conditional_mean
text: Calculates mean metric vector based q-values. Prioritizes values qval <= q_thresh. none exist, uses non-NA values.

title: Helper function to calculate conditional mean based on significance — calculate_conditional_mean
Helper function to calculate conditional mean based on significance — calculate_conditional_mean
text: metric_vec Numeric vector metric average (e.g., log2FC). qval_vec Numeric vector corresponding q-values. q_thresh Significance threshold q-values.

title: Helper function to calculate conditional mean based on significance — calculate_conditional_mean
text: calculated conditional mean, NA.

what: Calculate Node-Level Aggregate Statistics (Conditional on Significance) — calculate_node_aggregates_conditional
title: Calculate Node-Level Aggregate Statistics (Conditional on Significance) — calculate_node_aggregates_conditional
text: Calculates mean log2FC, p-value, q-value node (Label), prioritizing significant metabolites (qval <= q_value). none significant, uses measured metabolites node. Adds results dataframes.

title: Calculate Node-Level Aggregate Statistics (Conditional on Significance) — calculate_node_aggregates_conditional
Calculate Node-Level Aggregate Statistics (Conditional on Significance) — calculate_node_aggregates_conditional
text: nodes_sep_df Dataframe metabolites separated (e.g., 'nodes_final'). Must contain Label, log2FC, qval. nodes_orig_df Original dataframe potentially semi-colon separated metabolites. Must contain Label. q_value Significance threshold q-values (e.g., 0.05). stat_col_name p value column name values_col_name plotted column

title: Calculate Node-Level Aggregate Statistics (Conditional on Significance) — calculate_node_aggregates_conditional
text: list containing two dataframes:   $nodes_separated: Input nodes_sep_df 2 new columns:     node_values, node_stat   $nodes: Input nodes_orig_df 2 new columns:     node_values, node_stat

title: Filter metabolites — filter_metabolites
text: function filters certain classes metabolites metabolites vector. aggregated_data empty, metabolites class also filtered .

title: Filter metabolites — filter_metabolites
code: filter_metabolites(   metalyzer_se,   drop_metabolites = c("Metabolism Indicators"),   drop_NA_concentration = FALSE,   drop_quant_status = NULL,   min_percent_valid = NULL,   valid_status = c("Valid", "LOQ"),   per_group = NULL,   inplace = FALSE )

title: Filter metabolites — filter_metabolites
text: metalyzer_se SummarizedExperiment drop_metabolites character vector defining metabolite classes individual metabolites removed drop_NA_concentration boolean whether drop metabolites NAs concentration value drop_quant_status character, vector characters list characters specifying quantification status remove. Metabolites least one quantification status vector removed. min_percent_valid numeric lower threshold 0 1 (t less equal x) remove invalid metabolites meet given percentage valid measurements per group (default per Metabolite). valid_status character vector defines quantification status considered valid. per_group character vector column names meta_data used split metabolite groups. threshold `min_percent_valid` applied group. selected columns meta_data added aggregated_data. inplace FALSE, return copy. Otherwise, operation inplace return None.

code: plot_network(   log2fc_df,   q_value = 0.05,   metabolite_col_name = "Metabolite",   values_col_name = "log2FC",   stat_col_name = "qval",   metabolite_text_size = 3,   connection_width = 0.75,   pathway_text_size = 6,   pathway_width = 3,   exclude_pathways = NULL,   color_scale = "Viridis",   gradient_colors = NULL,   save_as = NULL,   folder_name = format(Sys.Date(), "%Y-%m-%d"),   folder_path = NULL,   file_name = "network",   format = "pdf",   width = 29.7,   height = 21,   units = "cm",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Plot Pathway Network — plot_network
text: log2fc_df dataframe log2FC, qval, additional columns q_value q-value threshold significance metabolite_col_name Columnname holds Metabolites values_col_name Column name column holds numeric values, plotted Default = "log2FC" stat_col_name Columnname holds numeric stat values used significance Default = "qval" metabolite_text_size text size metabolite labels connection_width line width connections metabolites pathway_text_size text size pathway annotations pathway_width line width pathway-specific connection coloring exclude_pathways Pathway names exluded plotting color_scale string specifying color scale use. Options include `"Viridis"`, `"Plasma"`, `"Magma"`, `"Inferno"`, `"Cividis"`, `"Rocket"`, `"Mako"`, `"Turbo"`, use `viridis` color scales. `"gradient"` selected, custom gradient applied based `gradient_colors`. gradient_colors vector length 2 3 specifying colors custom gradient. two colors provided (`c(low, high)`), `scale_fill_gradient()` used. three colors provided (`c(low, mid, high)`), `scale_fill_gradient2()` used. `NULL` incorrectly specified, viridis color scale applied. save_as Optional:  Select file type output plots. Options svg, pdf, png NULL. Default = "NULL" folder_name Name folder plot saved. Special characters removed automatically. Default = date folder_path Optional:  User-defined path folder created. provided, results saved `MetAlyzer_results` within working directory. Default = NULL file_name Name output file (without extension). Default = "network" format File format saving plot (e.g., "png", "pdf", "svg"). Default = "pdf" width Width saved plot specified units. Default = 29.7 height Height saved plot specified units. Default = 21.0 units Units width height (e.g., "", "cm", "mm"). Default = "cm" overwrite Logical: `TRUE`, overwrite existing files without asking. `FALSE`, prompt user overwriting. Default = FALSE

title: Plot Pathway Network — plot_network

Default 1.5 0.05, respectively. show_labels_for vector characters specifying names metabolites classes label. Note metabolites specified class labeled. Default NULL.

title: Open file and read data — read_webidq

title: Open file and read data — read_webidq
code: read_webidq(   file_path,   sheet = 1,   status_list = list(Valid = c("#B9DE83", "#00CD66"), LOQ = c("#B2D1DC", "#7FB2C5",     "#87CEEB"), LOD = c("#A28BA3", "#6A5ACD", "#BBA7B9"), `ISTD Out of Range` =     c("#FFF099", "#FFFF33"), Invalid = "#FFFFCC", Incomplete = c("#CBD2D7", "#FFCCCC")),   silent = FALSE )

title: MetAlyzer 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-06 Expanded visualization capabilities Plotly, allowing interactive data exploration. Minor bug fixes improve stability overall performance. Updated pathway data Excel file ensure accuracy relevance.

title: MetAlyzer 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-12 Rework MetAlyzer class SummarizedExperiment. Visualize log2FC metabolic pathway Expand possible number metabolites

title: MetAlyzer 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-01 Submitted CRAN
